label.value: Official title for the object.
Description of the object.
Name of the department, the user is assigned to.
The priority of the activity.
The person who has approved the Document.
Start date of the activity.
End date of the activity.
End date of the activity.
Start date of the activity.
The person who is assignee of the activity.
The person who is supervisor of the activity.
The participants in the activity.
The object to which the current object is part of.
Specifies which are the children of the object.
Description of the condition of the Frame.
The e-mail of the user/group.
The number of cultural objects involved in the activity.
Classification of the item.
Sub-classification of the item
Unique ID for the object in CS.
The source system of record.
The status of the item.
The version of the item.
The file name of the uploaded file.
Mimetype of the file: jpg, png, etc.
The size of the uploaded file.
The date of adding data about the item in the system.
The creator of the item in the system.
The date of last modification of the data about the object in the system.
The person that last modified the item in the system.
The person that has locked the item in the system.
The users added as watchers for the item.
The Primary Images that represents the current item.
The Cultural Object/Sample, that the image represents.
The Thumbnail image of the item.
The attachments of the current item.
The item to which the current item is attached to.
The Activity that the Cultural Object is involved.
The item processed by the activity.
The item to which the current item is parent of.
The item that is parent of the current item.
The revisions of the document.
The document to which the current document is revision of.
The last approved and published revisions of the document.
The last revisions of the document.
The revision that succeeds the current.
The revision that is successor of other revision.
Indicates the template of the item.
Rule description of current template.
Select attachment(s) for the current item
Select Cultural Object(s) for the current item
The status of the current item will be changed to In process
The status of the current item will be changed to Draft
The Cultural Object will be imported in the system
The Cultural Object data will be updated
The status of the current item will be changed to Obsolete
Select an image which to be primary for the Cultural Object
When you select the action, a published revision of the document will be created. The previously published version becomes "Obsolete"
When you select the action, a published PDF revision of the document will be created. The previously published version becomes "Obsolete"
When you select the action, an archived revision of the Cultural Object will be created
When you select the action, the document on which a workflow is started will be published
When you select the action, a task for further review will be assigned. The action is active in case major treatment is selected
When you select the action, the document on which a workflow is started will be published. The action is active in case a minor treatment is selected
When you select the action, a task for updating the document on which the workflow is started will be assigned
When you select the action, the document on which the workflow is started will become rejected. The document could not be edit any more
When you select the action the task will be completed. The workflow will proceed
When you select the action, the task for moving the cultural object will be completed
When you select the action, a task for updating the photos will be assigned
When you select the action, a task for taking samples will be assigned
The Document related to the Cultural Object.
When you select the action, the task will be completed
Select a document to be created/uploaded in the context of the item
Select a workflow to be executed on the item
Select a task to be created in the context of the item
Select a folder to be created in the context of the item
When you select the action, this version will be restored
You can create 'references' relationship with other items
Update the template of the item to the latest template version. The static content of the item may be lost
Select new template with which the current item to be presented. Any static content of the item will be lost
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to Resolved
When you select the action, the status of the current item will be changed to For Clarification
The purpose of the project e.g Exhibition, Loan etc.
Unique number that is assigned to a loan for an exhibition outside of NGA.
The Institution that has borrowed the Cultural Object.
Unique number that is assigned to a loan for an exhibition inside NGA.
The institution that has lend the Cultural Object for the Exhibition.
The exhibition tracking number used in a project.
The Author of the Document.
The Cultural Object(s) documented in the Document.
Date of the report.
Reason for sampling/motivation for sampling.
The data on which the sample analysis is requested.
Date of any analysis made on the Sample.
The Activity that the Cultural Object is involved.
Identifies is the document is legacy or not.
Defines the date when report was completed.
Defies the purpose of the document such as Loan, Exhibition, Travel and etc.
Indefies if the the document is related to single or multiple objects.
Indicates if the treatment is minor or major.
Name of the exhibition associated with the object.
The Loan ID associated with the object.
The corresponding filemaker pro number.
General description of the condition.
Description of the condition of the structure of the Cultural Object.
Description of the condition of the surface of the Sculpture or Decorative Art Cultural Object.
Description of the condition of the base.
Description of the condition of mounting when the Cultural Object is on the display.
Description of the condition of glued or attached layer or material for support.
Description of the condition of the permanent/original housing when the Cultural Object is in storage.
Description of the condition of the paper support.
The number of the page to be displayed.
Description of the Cultural Object substrate.
Medium description often used for public.
Description of the condition of the media applied to a Photograph.
Description of the sizing and ground condition.
Description of the paint layer or design condition.
Description of the surface coating condition.
Description of the condition of the image layer.
Description of the mat condition.
Description of the condition of the Cultural Object attachment to the mat.
Description of the condition of the Cultural Object framing package.
Description of the condition of the binder.
Description of the laminate condition.
Description of the preserver condition.
Description of the case condition.
Description of the case designated opening condition.
Description of product for analysis.
Trade name of the product.
Description of the material type.
The name of the product manufacturer.
Commercial Product contact person.
Date of contact.
Description of what was found by the analysis.
Description of the condition of the sample.
Description of the material composition based on analysis, material identified during the analysis.
Related Object(s) to the document.
Estimated expenses for the project.
Expected Outcome of a project.
Description of any watermarks evident in the paper/support.
Description of the support (paper, wood, etc) for the painting.
Description of the media used for the print.
Description of the frame.
Description of any secondary support.
Description of the mat.
Description of how the object is attached to the mat.
Description of unusual glazing requirement.
Description of the surface coating material.
Description of the mounting when Cultural Objects is on display.
Description of the permanent/unusual housing when the Cultural Objects is in storage.
The catalog number from NGA Library.
Description of the fabrication method of the Cultural Object.
The outside part or uppermost layer of something (often used when describing its texture, form, or extent).
Description of the base of the Cultural Object.
Description of the structure of the Cultural Object.
Description of the material that the Cultural Object is made of.
Number of the volume or set, usually includes year.
City of publication.
Language of volume.
The grouping within the NGA library.
Name of the creator of the object.
Specific Volume in a set.
Official title for a Cultural Object.
Unique ID for Cultural Object record in CS.
Sub-Classification of the Cultural Object.
The Primary Images that represents the current Cultural Object.
The Image(s) that depicts the Cultural Object.
The Cultural Object associated with the current Cultural Object.
The Cultural object that duplicates the current one.
The Sample which is taken from the Cultural Object.
A group of works of art created as a group.
Start/end dates and qualifiers such as "circa", "before", etc. Can have historical records of former attributions of creation dates.
Unique institutional ID.
Unique ID for object record (primary key often from authoritative system of record).
Medium description often used for public.
Notes made by the curator.
The physical attributes of the object without matte and/or frame. Both US and metric. Includes weight and other measures of the physical attributes of objects and their components.
A global number of the art work that appears in Catalogue Raisonne.
Description of any writing or printing on the object's obverse or reverse. Artist signature, dealer marks, inventory codes, etc.
Indication of distinguishing marks that have been applied to an object, including manufacturer's marks and labels, publisher's and printer's blind stamps.
Public credit line for the Cultural Object.
Historical ownership of the object.
Owner of the Cultural Object.
Departments responsible for the Cultural Object.
Home location of the Cultural Object. Could be a gallery or storage location where the Cultural Object normally is.
The location that the Cultural Object is physically resides currently.
A bibliography is a list of all of the sources used (whether referenced or not) in the process of researching the Cultural Object.
Cultural object weight.
Description of any special packing notes/instructions for the Cultural Object.
Description of any special environmental notes that the Cultural Object may require.
Description of any special handling that the Cultural Object may require.
Any special installation instruction that the Cultural Object may require.
Permanent/Original housing when the Cultural Object is in the storage, such as clam shell box, slip case.
Description of the paint layer or design construction.
Description of the sizing and ground construction.
Description of any material that holds the light sensitive materials.
Description of the image layer.
Description of media applied to photograph or to surface coating.
Description of framing package components put together by the institution including frame, glazing, and backing.
Description of glazing, face mounting, or laminate.
Description of preserver in a cased object.
Description of case.
Description of different weave characteristics in the Cultural Object.
Description of more specific details of how an Cultural Object is made based on examination.
Description of the structure of the Cultural Object.
Artists description of how the work is to be displayed/installed.
Description of the essential components that the artist indicates cannot be changed or replaced.
Variable components are components that may be changed, such as a projector type, or may not be included in a given installation.

Description of the associated materials. This would include materials provided by the artist that are used for installation/adjustment/repair of the work of art, but are not actually part of the work of art.
Description of the binding style, materials and construction.
Description of stamping, labels, or decoration to the binding.
Description of the printer's imposition and organization of the gatherings in a textblock, expressed in a shorthand formula.
The page to be displayed on the exhibition.
Witting on the back of the Frame.
Unique institutional ID.
Symbol representation of the barcode.
The name of the donor.
The name of the Vendor who sold us the Frame.
Vendor unique ID.
The count of the same type of the Frame that are held in the Inventory.
Additional notes on the Frame condition.
Outer dimension of the Frame.
Inside dimension of the Frame.
This is the size of the opening from the front of the Frame.
The measurement from the site edge to the outer edge of the Frame.
How deep is the cavity where the artwork sits.
Certain Frame styles are synonymous with a certain country.
A way of Painting, drawing, building, composing, etc.
Century of Frame.
The arrangement of the features as produced from following a plan.
Shape of the Frame.
Date of publication.
Location of the spot where the Sample was taken: coordinates "up" and "left" or "from right hand of the sitter".
Date on which the Sample was taken.
Physical location of the Sample so that someone could lay their hands on such as drawer number.
Cultural Object from which the Sample is taken from.
Description of the technique with which the sample was taken.
The Cultural Object depicted by the image.
Width of object (cm) depicted on the image. The value is used for the ruler in Mirador.
Height of the object (cm) depicted on the image.
The object, that the image is thumbnail of.
The vantage point of the image.
The source of the image.
Source institution of the Cultural Object.
The format of the source image.
Original identifier is name of the file from which a user creates the derivative.
The product type defines if the image is original raw data or product derivative.
The date that the image was produced. Production Date is different from date cataloged.
The stage of the treatment/examination
The spectral range type of light used for the photograph to be taken.
The name of the file from which a user creates the derivative.
The view of the Cultural Object.
Name of the photographer, who took the image.
Name of asset creator (scanned images or derivative files not created by original photographer).
The name of the camera or scanner.
Start date of the activity.
End date of the activity.
The estimated effort given by a person that is needed to complete the Activity. The effort is measured in man/days.
Reason for stopping the workflow.
When you select the action, the workflow will start its execution. The status of the workflow will be changed to In process.
When you select the action, the workflow execution will stop. The status of the workflow and the items within it will be changed to Stopped.
The reason for rejection the task
The outcome of a task that is part of workflow.
Indicates if the treatment is minor or major.
Object against which establishes help.
Type of object(s) associated with the task.
User ID.
Avatar of the User.
The first name of the user.
The last name of the user.
Name of the country of the user.
The address of the user.
Phone number of the user.
Mobile phone number of the user.
ID of the users account in instant messengers.
Name of the organization, the user is working in.
The job position of the user.
The language of the user.
The group the user is member of.
The activity the user is assignee to.
The activity the user/group of users is supervisor of.
The document that the user is author of.
The activity that the user/group of users is involved in.
The person who has approved the document.
The entities the user is watcher of.
Reporter of the item.
Users that are members of the group.
Activities involved of the group.
Title of the group.
Sub-type of the Issue.
The reporter of the Issue.
Due date of the Issue.
Resolution of the Issue.
Relationship to another issue that duplicates current ones.
References to items affected by the Issue.
Identifies the items that the current issue depends on.
The priority of the Issue.
The person who is assignee of the Issue.
